title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.3. ENABLING ENVIRONMENT / POLICY

description.narrative: By end 2021, actors at central and local levels have the capacity to lead the planning, programming, budgeting and monitoring and evaluation of policies and programmes addressing child rights, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Economic And Social Policy General, Human Rights Institutions, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: By the end of 2022, the Government makes better use of knowledge about the situation of children, especially the most disadvantaged, in decision-making and implements inclusive development policies and strategies with youth and adolescents' participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, actors at central and local levels have the capacity to lead the planning, programming, budgeting and monitoring andevaluation of policies and programmes addressing child rights

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued to support capacity strengthening in decentralized planning and budgeting with three more provincial plans finalized in 2021 and serving as a;springboard;for further replication in other priority provinces. UNICEF has also strengthened community participation through the initiation of participatory;community;diagnostics in three health districts.;Capacity building;to;strengthen;state actors’ ability to lead;planning, programming, and budgeting;was;extended to the area of social protection to ensure the availability of a new social protection strategy that;is shock-responsive and child-sensitive. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
